name: Titanium.Calendar
summary: The Calendar module provides an API for accessing the native calendar functionality.

events.name: change
events.summary: Fired when the database backing the EventKit module is modified.
events.description: This event is fired when changes are made to the Calendar database, including adding, removing, and changing events or reminders. Individual changes are not described. When you receive this notification, you should refetch all Event objects you have accessed, as they are considered stale. If you are actively editing an event and do not wish to refetch it unless it is absolutely necessary to do so, you can call the refresh method on it. If the method returns YES, you do not need to refetch the event.

methods.name: getCalendarById
methods.summary: Gets the calendar with the specified identifier.

methods.name: hasCalendarPermissions
methods.summary: Returns true if the app has calendar access.

methods.name: requestCalendarPermissions
methods.description:
On Android, the request view will show if the permission is not accepted by the user, and the user did not check the box "Never ask again" when denying the request. If the user checks the box "Never ask again," the user has to manually enable the permission in device settings. This method requests Manifest.permission.READ_CALENDAR and Manifest.permission.WRITE_CALENDAR on Android. If you require other permissions, you can also use requestPermissions.

In iOS 6, Apple introduced the Info.plist key NSCalendarsUsageDescription that is used to display an own description while authorizing calendar permissions. In iOS 10, this key is mandatory and the application will crash if your app does not include the key. Check the Apple docs for more information.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to call upon user decision to grant calendar access. Optional on SDK 10, as this method will return a Promise, which may be used to handle the result.

returns.summary: On SDK 10+, this method will return a Promise whose resolved value is equivalent to that passed to the optional callback argument.

methods.name: requestEventsAuthorization
methods.summary: If authorization is unknown, the system will bring up a dialog requesting permission.
methods.description: Note that the callback may be synchronous or asynchronous. That is, it may be called during requestEventsAuthorization or much later. See the "Request access to the events" example on how to best use this method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when when authorization is no longer unknown.

properties.name: allCalendars
properties.summary: All calendars known to the native calendar app.

properties.name: allEditableCalendars
properties.summary: All calendars known to the native calendar app that can add, edit, and delete items in the calendar.

properties.name: calendarAuthorization
properties.summary: Returns an authorization constant indicating if the application has access to the events in the EventKit.
properties.description: Always returns AUTHORIZATION_AUTHORIZED on iOS pre-6.0. type: Number

properties.name: defaultCalendar
properties.summary: Calendar that events are added to by default, as specified by user settings.

properties.name: eventsAuthorization
properties.summary: Returns an authorization constant indicating if the application has access to the events in the EventKit.

properties.name: selectableCalendars
properties.summary: All calendars selected within the native calendar app, which may be a subset of allCalendars.
properties.description: The native calendar application may know via the registered webservices, such as Gooogle or Facebook accounts about calendars that it has access to but have not been selected to be displayed in the native calendar app.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_AUTHORIZED
constants.summary: An calendarAuthorization value indicating that the application is authorized to use events in the Calendar.
constants.description: This value is always returned if the device is running an iOS release prior to 6.0.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_DENIED
constants.summary: An calendarAuthorization value indicating that the application is not authorized to use events in the Calendar.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_RESTRICTED
constants.summary: An calendarAuthorization value indicating that the application is not authorized to use events in the Calendar. the user cannot change this application's status.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: An calendarAuthorization value indicating that the authorization state is unknown.

constants.name: AVAILABILITY_BUSY
constants.description:
An availability value.

One of the group of event method constants, AVAILABILITY_NOTSUPPORTED, AVAILABILITY_BUSY, AVAILABILITY_FREE, AVAILABILITY_TENTATIVE, and AVAILABILITY_UNAVAILABLE.

constants.name: RECURRENCEFREQUENCY_DAILY
constants.summary: Indicates a daily recurrence rule for a events reccurance frequency.
constants.description:
Used with the frequency property.

One of the group of event "frequency" constants RECURRENCEFREQUENCY_DAILY, RECURRENCEFREQUENCY_WEEKLY, RECURRENCEFREQUENCY_MONTHLY, and RECURRENCEFREQUENCY_YEARLY.

constants.name: SPAN_FUTUREEVENTS
constants.summary: A save/remove event value, indicating modifications to this event instance should also affect future instances of this event.

constants.name: SPAN_THISEVENT
constants.summary: A save/remove event value, indicating modifications to this event instance should affect only this instance.
